Tool ID::Short description: Your web-based collaborative tool for treebank annotation and curation
Software::Software availability: Freely available online (with sign up option)
Data support::Data export: The data can be exported., The data can be stored with a third party storage platform
Annotation::Annotation scope: Annotation inside sentences
User Experience::Annotation display: Image (e.g. a graph or coloured text), Table, Raw format (e.g. CONLL-U)
User Experience::Collaborative annotatio: annotators working independently on their own annotations of the same data.
Tool ID::Additional features: ArboratorGrew can be used also to teach syntax. It has a mode when users can create exercises with different levels of complexity and export students results by the end  Users can also generate lexicons from your annotated data  And to ensure effective collaboration, ArboratorGrew provides a tag system

Tool ID::Short description: A graphical tool to annotate sentences in dependency syntax
Software::Software availability: Has to be run by the user (local machine or own server)
Annotation::Annotation scope: Annotation inside sentences
User Experience::Annotation display: Image (e.g. a graph or coloured text), Table, Raw format (e.g. CONLL-U), SD, LateX (tikz)
User Experience::Collaborative annotatio: partial
Tool ID::Additional features: git-support (automatic gid add/git commit; automatic generation of transliteration of non-Latin scripts into Latin-script (Translit= fields in MISC and trainsliteration of the entire sentence; statistics (number/percentage of UPOSes, deprels, etc). The tool can be used as a frontend to an parser which returns the result in CoNLL-U format

Tool ID::Short description: Flat (FoLiA Linguistic Annotation Tool) is a web-based linguistic annotation environment based around the FoLiA format (http://proycon.github.io/folia), a rich XML-based format for linguistic annotation.
Software::Software availability: Has to be run by the user (local machine or own server)
Data support::Input format: Raw text, CONLL-U, XML, TSV, FoLiA XML
Data support::Data export: The data can be exported., The data can be stored with a third party storage platform
Annotation::Annotation scope: Annotation inside sentences
User Experience::Collaborative annotatio: annotators working independently on their own annotations of the same data.
Tool ID::Example projects: - PARSEME (and some derived projects) - Piroska Lenvdai et al. "Workflow for HTR-Postprocessing, Labeling and Classifying Diachronic and Regional Variation in Pre-Modern Slavic Texts" - LREC 2024 - https://aclanthology.org/2024.lrec-main.184/

Tool ID::Short description: A version controlled annotation interace for XML and spreadsheet data, as well as nested NER

Tool ID::Short description: Text Annotation Platform
Software::Software availability: Has to be run by the user (local machine or own server), Freely available online (with sign up option)
Data support::Input format: Raw text, PDF, CONLL-U, XML, TSV
Data support::Integration of other resou: Audio, Video, Image, PDF, External databases
Annotation::Annotation scope: Annotation inside sentences, Annotation across sentences, Annotation of full sentences / paragraphs / documents
User Experience::Annotation display: Image (e.g. a graph or coloured text)
User Experience::Collaborative annotatio: annotators working independently on their own annotations of the same data.
Tool ID::Example projects: You can find many more by searching for INCEpTION on Google Scholar although note that not all papers that cite INCEpTION actually used it. E.g. they may also refer to it as related work (e.g. papers of other annotation editor tools) or have eventually chosen another tool to use.
Tool ID::Additional features: INCEpTION caters to a wide range of individual users who find different aspects of the tool useful. I would say that probably the ability to link to knowledge bases, the ability to work on sensitive data, the ability to use ML/AI to support the annotation process, the multi-user capabilities, curation support, agreement calculation support, and the range of supported data formats are among the most attractive features.  INCEpTION also caters to institutional users who need to integrate the tool into their existing infrastructure by supporting e.g. single-sign-on mechanisms, docker-based deployment, a remote API, etc.

Tool ID::Short description: A web-based collaborative tool for linguistic annotation that supports various annotation tasks, including POS tagging, dependency parsing, and coreference resolution. It provides collaborative features and works well with formats like CoNLL-U.
Software::Software availability: Available upon request (the user should ask to get an account)
Data support::Data export: The data can be exported., The data can be stored with a third party storage platform
Annotation::Annotation scope: Annotation inside sentences, Annotation across sentences, Annotation of full sentences / paragraphs / documents
User Experience::Annotation display: Image (e.g. a graph or coloured text), Table, Raw format (e.g. CONLL-U)
User Experience::Collaborative annotatio: annotators working independently on their own annotations of the same data., annotators working together on the same shared annotation of the data.
Tool ID::Additional features: WebAnno supports a rich set of features including customizable annotation layers, integration with external data sources, support for multiple annotators, and visualization of annotated data. It also supports automatic pre-annotation and inter-annotator agreement calculation
